intro: Pultenaea plumosa, commonly known as the silky pultenaea, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, delicate leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring, adding a soft, ornamental appearance. Its foliage is often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. Pultenaea plumosa is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions.
